alert.note: Alert for Cascade; Deer Lodge; Flathead; Glacier; Granite; Lake; Lewis and Clark; Mineral; Missoula; Powell; Ravalli; Sanders; Silver Bow (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Air Quality Alert issued September 11 at 8:54PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: The Montana Department of Environmental Quality has issued an air quality alert for Cascade, Deer Lodge, Flathead, Glacier, Granite, Lake, Lewis and Clark, Mineral, Missoula, Powell, Ravalli, Sanders, and Silver Bow Counties in effect until 10AM MDT 9/12/2022 This alert will be updated again at 10AM MDT 9/12/2022. An Air Quality Alert means that particulates have been trending upwards and that an exceedence of the 24 hour National Ambient Air Quality Standard (NAAQS) has occurred or may occur in the near future. As of 800 PM MDT, Particulate levels in Frenchtown, Missoula, Hamilton, and Great Falls are Unhealthy. As of 800 PM MDT, Particulate levels in Thompson Falls, The Flathead Valley, Seeley Lake, Cut Bank, Helena, and Butte are Unhealthy for Sensitive Groups. When air quality is Unhealthy... State and local health officials recommend that people with respiratory or heart disease, the elderly, and children should avoid prolonged exertion; everyone else should limit prolonged exertion. When air quality is Unhealthy for Sensitive Groups... State and local health officials recommend that people with respiratory or heart disease, the elderly and children should limit prolonged exertion. For more information visit the Montana Department of Environmental Quality at http://todaysair.mtdeq.us
